questions.question_text:
You encountered an insufficient privilege error in the middle of a long transaction.
The database administrator is informed and immediately grants the required privilege:
GRANT UPDATE ON world.city TO ‘user1’;
How can you proceed with your transaction with the least interruption?

choices.D: Close the connection, reconnect, and start the transaction again.
choices.C: Change the default database and re-execute the failed statement in your transaction.
choices.B: Re-execute the failed statement in your transaction.
choices.A: Roll back the transaction and start the transaction again in the same session.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In this situation, the database administrator has granted the required privilege (UPDATE on world.city) to 'user1', which was missing initially. To proceed with the transaction with the least interruption, you can re-execute the failed statement in your transaction. Since the privilege issue has been resolved by the administrator's action, re-executing the statement should work without any further issues. This approach minimizes interruption and allows you to continue your transaction without having to roll back the entire transaction or close and reconnect the connection.

B functional index
C virtual column with index.

choices.E:
ALTER TABLE employees -
ADD INDEX ((CAST(birth_date->>'$.month' AS unsigned)));
choices.A:
ALTER TABLE employees -
ADD INDEX (birth_date DESC);

comments.content: ACG, not sure about D because table structures are stored in data dictionary,.

questions.question_text: Which three sets of item information are visible in the mysql system database? (Choose three.)
Which statement is true about InnoDB persistent index statistics?

discussion.content:
this question is the same with Question #5.
D is not about persistent indexed. E might be the answer but not sure.

choices.B: Index statistics are calculated from pages buffered in the buffer pool for tables with InnoDB storage engine.
choices.E: Increasing innodb_stats_persistent_sample_pages determines higher pages scanning speed, at the cost of increased memory usage.
choices.C: Setting innodb_stats_auto_recalc=ON causes statistics to be updated automatically when a new index is created.
choices.A: Updating index statistics is an I/O expensive operation.
choices.D: Execution plans based on transient index statistics improve precision when innodb_stats_persistent_sample_pages is increased.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct is B
Answer is not there city is no in the world database that's why this error getting

choices.C: John needs to reconnect to the database.
choices.D: The DBA needs to execute FLUSH PRIVILEGES.
choices.B: John has not activated the role.
choices.A: The statement was blocked by MySQL Firewall.
